alert.note: Alert for Creek; McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Creek, western McIntosh, western Pittsburg, Okmulgee and Okfuskee Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 959 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Bristow to 2 miles southwest of Weleetka to 5 miles northeast of Stonewall. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Mcalester... Okmulgee... Bristow... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Weleetka... Dewar... Kiowa... Schulter... Depew... Indianola... Grayson... Hanna... Bearden... Slick... Hoffman... Castle... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 213 and 248. Interstate 44 between mile markers 181 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
